page.title: 12TRANSPORT THROUGH GRAFTON
page.content: The A439 runs through our area and lorries pass through carrying goods from Warwick and Leamington Spa to Evesham and Gloucester. It is also a popular holiday route.We did a traffic survey and cars were far more numerous than lorries. There were not so many lorries about 20 years ago because the railway was open and people used to walk from Temple Grafton on the way to Binton to go to work by train. Before then people travelled by boat and transported things like coal and timber to Stratford. A more modern way of travelling is by 'bus and there are four 'bus routes which pass through our area - Stratford to Evesham along one main road - Stratford to Evesham through Welford and Stratford to Evesham via Temple Grafton once in the morning and once in the evening.
